actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 p.m. on December 11, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Carter (TX) moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

Mr. Alford asked unanimous consent That when the House adjourns on Thursday, December 7, 2023 it adjourn to meet at noon on Monday, December 11, 2023 for Morning-Hour debate and 2:00 p.m. for legislative business. Agreed to without objection.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 914, Mr. Bowman of New York presented himself in the well of the House for the purpose of administration of censure by the Speaker of the House.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 214
actions-list.actionItem: 191, 5 Present (Roll no. 706).
Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 914 — "Censuring Representative Jamaal Bowman."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 210

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H.J. Res. 88 — "Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Department of Education relating to "Improving Income Driven Repayment for the William D. Ford Federal Direct Loan Program and the Federal Family Education Loan (FFEL) Program"."
The Chair announced that the unfinished business was on passage of H.J. Res. 88 and on agreeing to H. Res. 914, which were debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 7.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

At the conclusion of debate on H.J. Res. 88, the Chair put the question on passage and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Foxx demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.J. Res. 88.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4468, H.R. 5933 and H.J. Res. 88. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 4468 and H.R. 5933 under a structured rule and H.J. Res. 88 under a closed rule. Rule provides for one hour of general debate and one motion to recommit on each measure.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 906. H.J. Res. 88 — "Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Department of Education relating to "Improving Income Driven Repayment for the William D. Ford Federal Direct Loan Program and the Federal Family Education Loan (FFEL) Program"."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Ms. Dean of PA to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Bishop Larry Lawrence Brandon, Praise Temple, Shreveport, Louisiana.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
